Keywords: Armor , Latveria , Mystical , Ruler , Scientist
Real Name: Victor Von Doom
Special Powers
THE MANY FACES OF DOOM: At the beginning of the game, you may choose a starting line of equal points on a character from your sideline that also has this trait. If you do, replace this character with the chosen character.
TIME PLATFORM: Dr. Doom may start the game with FFFF #s010 Time Platform equipped. When he uses its EFFECT to choose to return to his starting area, he isn't dealt the 1 unavoidable damage.
I WANT THAT TREASURE!: FREE: Once per game, remove a FFFF #s010 Time Platform equipped to Dr. Doom from the game. If you do, equip Dr. Doom with an equipment of 10 points or less on an opponent's force (on the map or equipped to one of their characters).
LEARN FROM THE PAST: At the beginning of the game, roll two d6s and place the results on this card. If Dr. Doom is 150 points, roll three d6s instead. // Whenever any attack roll is made, you may replace a d6 in the roll with a d6 from this card.
Trade Dr. Doom Want Dr. Doom

January 5, 2023
Coyote's Own
Standart disclaimer: Rule question in tje rules forum, terrible text formatting in the actual units section comments (what I post below will almost unreadable) 21.4 Replacing Dice Some effects allow you to replace a die result with another die result. These effects can only be done after both players choose not to reroll the result (if applicable). When a die is replaced, the replaced die is removed from play (and returned to the owner of that die). If a die in a roll is replaced, the result of the roll is changed to reflect the new result with the replaced die. Comprehensive rulebook p. 51
January 5, 2023
godfather22
Question: say you are being attack and your opponent needs a 8 to hit. Your opponent rolls at 5 and 3. You then decide to replace the 5 with the "Learn From The Past" ability and you replace it with a 1. Your opponent's new modified roll is now a 1 and 3. Can your opponent decide to now probability control the roll? I hope not.

March 10, 2021
tidge
While this dial may not be the most exciting of the FFFF Doom chase figures (and all of them have weaknesses for 150-point figures, IMO) the '62 Dr. Doom is absolutely the one you want on any starting force if you plan to switch to any other of the Doom chase figures, because the Time Platform will be left behind. The dice manipulation effect (along with the Time Platform) aren't insanely powerful, but offer thematic tricks for Dr. Doom to rely on.
March 10, 2021
mike_houghton
[QUOTE=logangodofcandy;12120265]Seems like a rip off for 150 on a chase. You get two potentially and statistically probably crappy die rolls. To swap out only for two attacks. Garbage version of probability control if you ask me. He gets two garbage probability control only on his own attacks and then he has okay attack and okay damage and okay defense with Outwit on a long dial? Even his team ability is complete garbage. Just Outwit him and hit him with a single 75pt character holding a heavy object and he's now worth 75pts. Easter of points.[/QUOTE] What lol? You get 3 dice for 150 points. They can be used on ANY attack by ANY character ANYwhere on map. You get all 1s? Great! Switch out on your opponents attack. You get some 5s or 6s? That's gonna make it easier for you to hit. On top of that he can steal someone else's equipment or protect yourself from someones big attack with the time platform.

March 6, 2021
Redrover454
Any player that tries to tell you that the dice stay on his card is trying to cheat you. You roll a 6 for one of his dice and you can just put a 6 in EVERY attack you make with ANY character on your force AND there's no lof requirement? Really? What if you rolled a 1? You could do the same thing to every one of your opponents attacks and they'd have to crit just to get a 7. I get the wording is a bit off, but if you really think Wizkids would want something like that in their game then you're fooling yourself.

February 17, 2021
Owlman166
Best chase in the set, bar none, if he uses the Time Platform. He's got his own built in Protected feat. All that Outwit means his attacks will stick most of the time, and Phasing gets him where he needs to go. A must have figure for me!
February 16, 2021
DatHomieSilverSurfer
Darn do I find this DOOM to be so appealing. I'm a sucker in general for simple dials and silver age sculpts, which this doom has in spades. He may be the best representation of OG doom we've ever gotten, and his time machine gimmick is fun as hell without being some ridiculous stat boost
February 16, 2021
Goop
Your "many faces" call in if your opponent is using equips. Stealing it and having 2 or 3 free dice replacement effects at the start is where this guy really shines. No move and attack so you are best putting him on a rooftop and zapping/outwitting from afar or bring some TK. I'd say 150 is overcosted by a lot though, he is VERY strong at 75.
